Enrico Caruso was an Italian operatic tenor. He sang to great acclaim at the 
major opera houses of Europe and the Americas, appearing in a wide variety of 
roles from the Italian and French repertoires that ranged from the lyric to the 
dramatic. Caruso also made approximately 260 commercially released 
recordings ... At the age of 22, Caruso made his professional stage debut.
